name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Impaired vocal cord mobility, also described as vocal cord paresis, may suggest invasion of intrinsic laryngeal muscle. Fixation of the vocal cord may be described as immobility of the arytenoids noted on endoscopy, vocal cord cord paralysis, or deviation of larynx to fixed side.

**Note 2:**  Assign T1 for localized tumor only if no information is available to identify further extension.
rows:
Tumor limited to one subsite of supraglottis with 
normal vocal cord mobility

Invasive tumor confined to anterior surface of epiglottis with normal vocal cord mobility

Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor invades mucosa of more than one adjacent subsite
of supraglottis or glottis or region outside the supraglottis
(e.g., mucosa of base of tongue, vallecula, medial wall of
pyriform sinus) without fixation of the larynx

Mucosa of adjacent subsite(s) of oropharynx

Mucosa of vallecula without fixation of larynx

Mucosa of adjacent subsite(s) of supraglottis (including posterior surface of epiglottis) 
WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Larynx, glottic or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Mucosa of pyriform sinus, medial wall or NOS WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Mucosa of base of tongue WITHOUT fixation of larynx

Stated as T2

Tumor limited to larynx with vocal cord fixation and/or 
invades any of the following:
Postcricoid area
Pre-epiglottic space
Paraglottic space
Inner cortex of thyroid cartilage

Any structure coded in T1 or T2 WITH vocal cord fixation

Hypopharynx, NOS
Inner cortex of thyroid cartilage (minor erosion)
Paraglottic space
Pre-epiglottic tissues
Postcricoid area
Pyriform sinus except medial wall 

Stated as T3
Stated as T4 [NOS] with no other information on extension

Tumor invades through the thyroid cartilage and/or 
invades tissues beyond the larynx, e.g., trachea, soft
tissues of neck including deep/extrinsic muscle of tongue
(genioglossus, geniohyoid, hyoglossus, mylohyoid, 
palatoglossus and styloglossus), strap muscles, thyroid, 
esophagus

Soft palate, inferior surface including uvula
Soft palate, superior (nasopharyngeal) surface
Soft palate, NOS

Nasopharynx, NOS

Deep tissues of base of tongue
Buccal mucosa (inner cheek)
Floor of mouth
Gum (gingiva)
Pterygoid muscle
Soft tissues of neck
Trachea 
Thyroid

Invasion of, through outer cortex of thyroid cartilage
Thyroid cartilage, NOS

Strap muscles:
    Omohyoid
    Sternohyoid
    Thyrohyoid

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery,
or mediastinal structures

Prevertebral fascia or muscle

Further contiguous extension, including:
    Anterior 2/3 of tongue
    Bone
    Hard palate
    Mandible
    Parotid gland

Stated as T4b

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
